channel.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
channel.description: So what do you think of the concept of items degrading in combat? Not only pvp armours, but like all items. For example: you pvm/pvp with a whip for I don't know let's say 200 smacks worth, and it 'breaks' and becomes weaker. 200 hits later it becomes degraded and completely unusable/wieldable. What do you do then? You get a '"repair kit" (for example the ID 1:toolkit) and use it on the item, and repair it, at the same time destroying your toolkit. Now these toolkits cost say.. 5000gp each. But the toolkit only works on fully degraded items. For an item with the half degrade that I mentioned earlier you would get a half o' toolkit which would cost say... 2500 gp? Thoughts?

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Kodiak:

then again you’d have to replicate every single combat item and make a half degraded/full degraded version of it which would take ages. then you would have to add the useitem for every single one of them. scratch this idea for me, I don’t even feel like doing all that lol

Would be simple to tag some meta data on the items to differentiate the two… With all the customization we do to the clients I’m surprised you guys STILL think its necessary to create entirely new items for things like this

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

It’s a decent idea for a gold sink, however I think that degrading items really only need to be applied when the item is considered an artifact of Runescape.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

PK Syndicate:

Well you think, a player has 99 HP and can heal. 200 hits would go in 30 seconds, 5 seconds with DDS specs. I would start somewhere around 15,000 hits and calculate how long that would take to degrade.

I’m pretty sure that he meant 200 hits as in…

[ul][li]5[/li]
[li]6[/li][/ul]

That would be 2 hits.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

Well you think, a player has 99 HP and can heal. 200 hits would go in 30 seconds, 5 seconds with DDS specs. I would start somewhere around 15,000 hits and calculate how long that would take to degrade.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

This idea could work if the degrading time was low. 200 hits is way too low, that’s for sure. 200 hits is like not even a full game of jad, to put in in perspective, and it’s already expensive enough to go in there already(assuming the economy is good).

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I don’t approve. I dislike how Barrows armor degrades, and although degrading realistic, it can ruin the fun and flow of the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

I would go on relativity. If you can pickpocket 100-500 coins per thieve, have it cost around 50-75k. If you can thieve 1m per attempt, have it cost 50-100m.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

the 10m was based off of the generic PI leech. You can on average make about 10m-50m an hour pvming can’t you? o_0

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Java-RSPS-Noob, post:11, topic:525974”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=644719.msg4337972#msg4337972 date=1374689830]

5,000gp on a rsps is nothing. Make it like 10m a toolkit that or make it so toolkits are from a drop to even make it rarer. Make it so the boss that drops it can only be fought by the same ip/person so many times in a day.

Lmfao 10m. #RuinedEco
[/quote]don’t see how you get that…more a product costs = more money OUT of the economy.[/quote]I would really go by rs’s prices for this.

You make it seem so easy to obtain 10m in an rsps.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

I’ll admit, I only read the title and first sentence. But my post still relevantly applies.

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

I’m kinda in the middle of this. It would help the economy if you made toolkits for fixing them more expensive, but it’s also extremely annoying.

Suggestion: Rename some items and make toolkits for each kind of metal. (bronze repair kit, steel repair kit, etc. etc.)

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“PK Syndicate, post:6, topic:525974”]With the exception of barrows, I have always detested weapons being degradeable. I just find it generally annoying, and there are other ways to balance the power of weapons other than having them crumble to dust.

If a weapon is so strong then why does it crumble to dust, when a bronze dagger can be used indefinitely? It’s illogical.[/quote]I think he was talking about making all weapons/armors to degrade including bronze

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @PK_Syndicate PK Syndicate
item.description:
@PK_Syndicate wrote:

With the exception of barrows, I have always detested weapons being degradeable. I just find it generally annoying, and there are other ways to balance the power of weapons other than having them crumble to dust.

If a weapon is so strong then why does it crumble to dust, when a bronze dagger can be used indefinitely? It’s illogical.

Read full topic

item.title: Degrading items - Whats your thoughts?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Kodiak, post:3, topic:525974”]did you even read my post? the prices were just a general idea, of course that’s way too cheap. you never even criticized/supported the idea[/quote]I support the idea I was just stressing the overall need to make sure the price is equally fair. I would also have the degration period be different for each item. Maybe take it a step further and require certain rarer items to require maybe more than one toolkit? (or a higher level tier toolkit!)

Read full topic
